BY SUNITA HANJURA

Former president of JHU women's center Rebecca Wright

Rebecca Wright resigned as
president of the JHU M. Carey
Thomas Women's Center October 13th, touching off a major
leadership shake-up in the organization. Since then, secretary
Laura Rosenthal and treasurer
Lois McCoy have also quit.

vacancies. Members chose Laura
Rosenthal as their new president, Ellen Farina as vice president, David Rintoul as secretary,
Nancy Galib as treasurer, and
Margaret Lipschutz as publicity
coordinator.
When asked why she resigned, Wright cited "personal commitments" and limitations on
her time. "My other commitments are too great for me to be
able to do an adequate job,"

she said. She added that she was
"not getting as much out of the
Center as(she) put in."
Some members felt that
disagreements over the Center's
goals may have hindered effectiveness of Wright's leadership.
